Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh got Parvez Hossain Emon to edge it back onto the stumps.
Varun Chakaravarthy took three wickets in the fifth over.
Hardik Pandya finished the match in style with a huge six over midwicket.
Sanju Samson scored 29 runs off 19 balls with 6 fours.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 29 runs off 14 balls with 2 fours and 3 sixes.
Hardik Pandya scored 39 not out with 5 fours and 2 sixes.
Pre-Game Insights: India barely broke a sweat in a thumping seven-wicket win over Bangladesh in the first T20I here on Sunday.
Varun Chakaravarthy made his comeback to the national side after three years.
The anchor was dropped as early as the first over, when Litton Das skied Arshdeep Singh without purpose.
In his next over, a consistent Arshdeep got Parvez Hossain Emon to edge it back onto the stumps.
Varun entered the attack in the fifth over, and was unlucky to see Nitish drop a catch in the deep.
Post-Match Reflections: India’s Hardik Pandya, right, and teammate Nitish Kumar Reddy celebrate India’s win in the first T20I against Bangladesh in Gwalior.
It was a memorable night for Varun Chakaravarthy, who made his comeback to the national side after three years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The packed house at the Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Cricket Stadium, hosting its first international match, was treated to fireworks in the chase.
All eyes turned to Mayank Yadav, who was making his international debut.
Mayank, who lit up IPL 2024 with his searing pace, started with a maiden.
Nitish was not as successful with the ball. His medium pace and variations proved to be easy pickings, prompting the skipper to keep him down to two overs.
